content.1: In the mean time, when there were gathered together an innumerable multitude of people, insomuch that they trode one upon another, he began to say unto his disciples first of all,
content.2: For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.
content.3: Therefore whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.
content.4: And I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill the body, and after that have no more that they can do.
content.5: But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.
content.6: Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?
content.7: But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
content.8: Also I say unto you, Whosoever shall confess me before men, him shall the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:
content.9: But he that denieth me before men shall be denied before the angels of God.
content.10: And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.

content.24: Consider the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which neither have storehouse nor barn; and God feedeth them: how much more are ye better than the fowls?
content.25: And which of you with taking thought can add to his stature one cubit?
content.26: If ye then be not able to do that thing which is least, why take ye thought for the rest?
content.27: Consider the lilies how they grow: they toil not, they spin not; and yet I say unto you, that Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

content.29: And seek not ye what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubtful mind.
content.30: For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.
content.32: Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
content.33: Sell that ye have, and give alms; provide yourselves bags which wax not old, a treasure in the heavens that faileth not, where no thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.
content.34: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
